intro: Pedicularis groenlandica subsp. surrecta, commonly known as the Greenland betony, is a flowering plant native to Arctic and alpine regions of northern Europe and North America. It is a perennial herb that grows in rocky and open habitats, often in tundra or mountainous areas. The plant produces showy, spurred flowers that are typically pink or purple, with a distinctive lip-shaped petal. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. The species is adapted to cold climates and has a long flowering period during the short summer season.
